did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Dr. Griswold's "Autobiographical Notes, prepared for his descendants" (247 pp., 1938-40); two printed copies of Griswold's studies of Hinduism; five typed or printed items pertaining to his career as a missionary at Forman Christian College, Lahore, India (now Pakistan); pamphlet "Sketches of My Indian Childhood" by Frances Griswold Wooddell (116 pp., n.d.); genealogical pamphlet on the Griswold family of Dryden, New York; and typescript poems by Hervey De Witt Griswold (28 pp.).

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Missionary, professor of philosophy, Presbyterian minister.
Hervey DeWitt Griswold received his Ph.D. from Cornell in 1900.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Dr. Griswold's "Autobiographical Notes, prepared for his descendants" (247 pp., 1938-40); two printed copies of Griswold's studies of Hinduism; five typed or printed items pertaining to his career as a missionary at Forman Christian College, Lahore, India (now Pakistan); pamphlet "Sketches of My Indian Childhood" by Frances Griswold Wooddell (116 pp., n.d.); genealogical pamphlet on the Griswold family of Dryden, New York; and typescript poems by Hervey De Witt Griswold (28 pp.).

did.unittitle: Manuscript: "Autobiographical Notes, prepared for his descendants," written by Dr. Griswold between Aug. 1938 and Apr. 1940 [see pp. 1, 246]. 247 pp., written on lined loose-leaf notebook paper. Chapter contents as follows:

list.item: I. "Early Days and First School," pp. 1-7.
II. "The Dryden School and Youthful Poetry," pp. 7-36.
III. "Miscellaneous Experiences at High School," pp. 36-48.
XI. "In India, 1891," pp. 179-247. [Actually includes entire career in India; work for Ph.D. at Cornell, 1899-1900; family; travels in Europe and Near East; people met, etc.]
